author: A_Brickset_user
title: Some good parts... value for money.
review: One of those cheap lego-sets. This one was propably my first lego ever. The blue chair was one of my most-used-lego parts ever, as I used it on every space ship / airplane that I ever built. Very little parts but all of them are useful.

author: Rick76
title: Cheap and great set
review: My grandmother bought me this set, and by coincidence i bought it too... a great addition to any galaxy explorer owner, (it fitted perfectly in the cargo compartment). This set was just US 0.99$ when I got it... and it was great !!!!

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Super Rocket Moon Buggy Thing
review:
How can a Space collector not like this set?

Minifigures:
  • Bright white astronaut leader, barely smaller than his rover.
Nitro Rocket Fuel Injection
The blue design, funny red light ended nose bar, retros and rear thruster, space age chair and classic red hubcap wheels so close together, it could have been designed by a skilled little kid. 

This is why its so good, its simplicity gave an example of easy but fun builds kids could try with all their spacey bricks. Forget the steering wheel, the white astronaut can go as fast as rocket fuelled buggies can be pushed while trying to call in on the CB radio, where is he going?

The multitude of the small space set range is amusing to look through; inventive, inspiring and iconic. Even when simplistic, they still drove imagination and added another story to space landscapes. The rear thruster is the top brick here.

author: BrickCrafter3_14
title: Cool Little Set
review: I built this set going through my dads old parts. It was a lot of fun to find everything and show my dad what I did.
